page.title: 20PEOPLE'S ATTITUDES
page.content: The countryside around is very pleasant with many enchanting walks and interesting houses. The county is known as "leafy Bucks." and living here one can certainly see why. Much of the land around was originally strip farming and historically it is very interesting. The coming of the railway helped to open up the area and bring London and its life and attitudes much closer. The people tend to be moving upwards socially and are keenly aware of the importance of education. This has its good and its bad side. For education tends not to be valued for itself; instead it is seen as a prerequisite for acquiring greater material wealth. The local inhabitants are competitive, perhaps rather dissatisfied, and they do not seem to value culture. It is really rather depressing.
